turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Q! How are you?

turns.speaker: Q
turns.text: Retired. I'm not getting paid to help you save the world anymore.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: I'm sorry. It was a national emergency -

turns.speaker: Q
turns.text: That hardly makes up for the imposition.  Now, for what I hope will be the very last time - pay attention, 007.  First, computer generated retrograde analysis map. Body here, meteorolog- ical influences here, likely vector- ing of the ship's coordinates here.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Do you have any idea of what any of that means? In English?

turns.speaker: Q
turns.text: Not a clue. I didn't lose the ship.  Next, your new personal communicator.  Picture-phone, fax, beeper.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Do I have to dial '9' to get out?

turns.speaker: Q
turns.text: I don't care who you dial, so long as it's not me. Next -

turns.speaker: Q
turns.text: Your new car.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: - Four wheel drive?

turns.speaker: Q
turns.text: Yes. And do try to keep all four of them on the road.  All the usual refinements: Smoke, missiles, machine guns -  Fully operational remote control. Drives forward, reverse -  Stop that!  Plus infrared thermal imaging radar, heads up instrumentation, and 17 beverage cup holders.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: ... 17 Beverage cup holders?

turns.speaker: Q
turns.text: Standard equipment. The world's automobile manufacturers seem to be in some kind of mad war to see who can provide the most beverage cup holders.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: I must say, Q, you seem to be doing rather well in your retirement.

turns.speaker: Q
turns.text: Don't even think about it. 007. They're my granddaughters.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Yes -

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN MORTON
turns.text: Guard! Arrest these men! Escort them to the cutter!

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Wait a minute -

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN MORTON
turns.text: Get them out of here. If he says one word, shoot him.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Don't you think you're overreacting?

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN MORTON
turns.text: Yes. The famous James Bond. I've heard all about you, sir. You were under direct orders to act as an observer - and yet you had to go off, on your own, like some half-assed CIA cowboy -  Endangering the gold, attracting that lunatic woman, and then putting in a distress call for us to save your bloody hide.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: ...That's all well and good, Captain, save for one thing:  There's no gold down there.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN MORTON
turns.text: What are you talking about? We went through all this and the ship isn't even down there?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Yes, the ship is down there. But the gold is gone.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN MORTON
turns.text: That's absurd! It took two squads of forty men fifteen days to load that gold.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: I know what I saw -

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Paris?!? What are you doing here?

turns.speaker: PARIS
turns.text: Is that any way to say hello?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: I thought your specialty was good-bye.

turns.speaker: PARIS
turns.text: Oh, James. I've missed you -

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Is this another one of your games?

turns.speaker: PARIS
turns.text: Stop it! You're hurting me! Can't you just be nice?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: I've got half the British government breathing down my neck. I don't have time for your nonsense.

turns.speaker: PARIS
turns.text: Don't you even miss me? Didn't I mean anything to you?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: What about Elliot Harmsway? Or is this just another one of your stunts?

turns.speaker: PARIS
turns.text: No! He's crazy - he's insane. He hates everybody. He's got these plans -  You've got to help me, James. I'm sorry. I'm sorry for everything. I know I was wrong - but you've got to protect me. I know you still love -

turns.speaker: PARIS
turns.text: Do you feel better now?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Do you?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: What about the uranium?

turns.speaker: PARIS
turns.text: It's on the boat. He's holding a press conference tomorrow.

turns.speaker: PARIS
turns.text: I'm so sorry, James. I promise, I'll never leave you again.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Shhhhh...

turns.speaker: PARIS
turns.text: Just hold me.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Paris -

turns.speaker: PARIS
turns.text: Leave me alone! He's going to kill me!!

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Why didn't you tell me? Why wasn't it in our files?

turns.speaker: PARIS
turns.text: He didn't want anyone to know. He kept it out of the papers. He said a third wife was bad for his image.  You've got to protect me!

turns.speaker: PARIS
turns.text: Just - say it. Say it just once.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: One thing at a time. I'll see you in twenty minutes. Go.

turns.speaker: MINISTER JOHNSTONE
turns.text: His newspapers?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Occasionally, yes.  British media mogul. Born in Hong Kong; controls newspapers, TV, radio, cable, satellites; books, magazines, movies, computer software. Theme parks.

turns.speaker: MINISTER JOHNSTONE
turns.text: More scurrilous, unsubstantiated gossip.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Perhaps. But it does explain how an ex-KGB agent turned illegal-arms dealer is suddenly portrayed as a long-time friend of the people.  If you believe what you read in the papers.

turns.speaker: MINISTER JOHNSTONE
turns.text: Need I remind the two of you that Elliot Harmsway - Sir Elliot Harmsway - is directly descended from the Earl of Aberdeen? That his Scottish ancestors practically invented Hong Kong - and out of sheer gratitude, Queen Victoria herself named the port "Aberdeen Harbor" in their honor?

turns.speaker: MINISTER JOHNSTONE
turns.text: There is one last thing, 007: Elliot Harmsway is vital to the economic interests of this nation. He's also a major contributor to the party. I expect him to be given every consideration.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Political considerations?

turns.speaker: MINISTER JOHNSTONE
turns.text: To the best of my recollection, Mr. Bond, I suggested no such thing.  In fact, I was never here.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Okay, Saunders. What is it this time? Rocket in the leg? Machine pistol in the arm?

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: Q's retirement party. I'd just put the knife into the cake, and -

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Come on. I know better than that -

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: It must do something.

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: Well... If you insist.

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: Now pay attention, 007. We haven't much time to demonstrate your new Q toys.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: How is old Q?

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: Gone fishing.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Fishing?

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: Big game fishing.  Sonar torpedoes. Retirement gift from his friends at the CIA.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Saunders, I've lit cigarettes -

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: Not from forty feet.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: ... Shoelaces?

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: Plastique explosive shoelaces.  Cut them to regulate the size of the blast; totally harmless until you attach the detonator hidden in the heel of your shoe.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Perfect way to tie up a... 'Knotty' problem?

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: Moving along -  A typical plastic security card. Name here, magnetic information stripe here -  And a code breaking microprocessor here. Swipe it through any card reader - anywhere - you're in.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Does it work on cash machines?

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: It was an authorized test. I returned the money.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: I see...

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: Finally, your new watch: Blue laser here for signaling or burning through locks; press this button, the sweep hand becomes a Geiger counter.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: If you can't do the time, don't do the crime?

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: Oh. I almost forgot. There is one last thing: Before Q retired, he asked that I give you one other protective device.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: A wedding band??? What am I supposed to be able to do with this?

turns.speaker: SAUNDERS
turns.text: I believe Q's exact words were:  "Hopefully, nothing."

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Wade, what the hell are you doing here?

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: I am not here, ol' buddy. The CIA has absolutely no knowledge of the missing ship, the missing gold, where it was going, or when it left Hong Kong.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: That's reassuring.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Hey - the world is my office.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Let's take a look at the body.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: I don't know if you'd call it a boat...

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Something with an engine? Not oars?

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Step into my office.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: What do you want with the Harbor Master?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Tide and current charts. Work backward from the body - find where the ship sank.  Where did you get the boat?

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Seized it from a guy smuggling computer chips out of Bangkok.  Should have seen his rose garden: Blooms the size of hand grenades.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: I think I've just seen my next future ex-wife.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Not if you kill us first - unless that's how you plan to leave Muffy.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Natalya?

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Yeah. Russian Minister of Transportation.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: She married a hockey player.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: I envy your 'undercover' assignments.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: We work in the dark. We do what we can.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: I have to get these to London. Do you know this Captain Cheong?

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Spends his nights at the Kuala Lumpur yacht club.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Can you arrange a meeting?

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Hell. The CIA built that club.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Yo! Jimbo! I won five hundred -  What happened?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: He tied one on.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: I dunno, Jimbo. It can't be out here. How could they get this far off course?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Who knows? Fog, night...

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: They'd never sail this close to the shore.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Wait a minute -  I've got it. There! Off the port bow!

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: I got you covered.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: That's reassuring.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Sidney Winch, meet -

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Jack Wade. Citibank. Commercial loan division. If you're ever lookin' for a sweet refinance on the boat -

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Where to now, Jimbo?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: I'm not certain... But I think there's someone I want to press for some answers in Kuala Lumpur.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Interesting presentation.

turns.speaker: DOMINIQUE
turns.text: Interesting video tape.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: They point, I shoot.

turns.speaker: DOMINIQUE
turns.text: Do you have a pen? I just got promoted and don't have my new cards yet.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Of course.

turns.speaker: DOMINIQUE
turns.text: ... Does this do anything?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Depends what number you write.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Married?

turns.speaker: DOMINIQUE
turns.text: Happily.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: ... Kids?

turns.speaker: DOMINIQUE
turns.text: Three. You? Married?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DOMINIQUE
turns.text: I didn't think so.

turns.speaker: DOMINIQUE
turns.text: Here. I gave you my assistant's phone number. If it's urgent, she knows where to reach me.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Thanks.  Take care -

turns.speaker: DOMINIQUE
turns.text: You too.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Bourbon. Neat.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: I wonder if you handle your liquor more carefully than you handle your boat.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Sometimes, you just have to plunge into things. Be reckless.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: - And I bet you always leave turmoil in your wake.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Have we met?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: This afternoon. Our boats practically kissed in the harbor.  James Bond.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Sidney Winch.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Vodka martini, shaken not stirred.  And another for you?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: No. But you can buy a drink for my friend, Taro.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Boyfriend?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Chaperone. I'm waiting for my dinner date.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Pity.  Bring him whatever he wants.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: So what brings you to Kuala Lumpur, Mr. Bond?  Wait - don't tell me: Unhappy marriage? Running from some poor little girl with two kids and a Chanel pocketbook in - London?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Actually, I'm here on business. You might say it was a... Golden opportunity.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: And exactly what business are you in, Mr. Bond?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Insurance. Lloyds of London.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: The Strait can be a very dangerous place, Mr. Bond. A few words scribbled on a piece of paper in London doesn't carry a lot of value out here. Including life insurance.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: I'll keep that in mind.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: I see my date is here.  And I think Mr. Bond is ready to leave.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Nice to run into you again.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Let's not make it a habit.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: - Shut up!

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: You have to excuse Miss Winch: She thinks she's on a 'seduce and destroy' mission through life...  ...But she won't kill us.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: No?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: No. First, because I don't think it's in your nature. And second, because there's no gold down there.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: So charming! So suave!  Don't insult me. I'm not one of your 'little London girls' who falls for the lies.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Do I have to do everything around here?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: I hope so.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: I hope you'll be gentle.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Think about mom.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: And what do you call this?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: - The family jewels?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: If I were you -

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: - You're not.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Just remember: They think there's ten billion dollars in gold down there.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Thank you.  "Now hear this: Drop dead."

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Why don't we just take these -

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: No. I want Sir Elliot to keep them.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: ... Do you have a gun?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: You heard me. A gun?  I left mine in the car.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: That's funny: you struck me as the kind of man who always carries protection.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Listen to me! I'm a British secret service agent. And we have about two minutes before Harmsway kills both of us.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Harmsway sank that ship and stole the gold. It's on the Sea Dolphin II.  And thanks to your little show and tell -  - giving him the evidence -  We're the only ones who can tie him to the crime.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Elliot Harmsway is my Uncle!

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Blood or Dutch?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: He was my father's best friend!

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: He's killed closer.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: You are seriously deranged.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Maybe. But why are we going up instead of down?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: This has got to be a mistake.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: The only mistake is that they didn't kill us in the elevator.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Wait here.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: No. I'm going with you.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: ... How did you get into marine salvage?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: My father left me the business.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Not a lot of difference.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: What the hell does that do?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Cleans dirt. Let's go.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Down?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Up.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: What now? And don't give me some movie clich√© like 'trust me.'

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Trust me.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Put your back to the railing. Sit up on it.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Are you listening to me?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Put your arms around my neck. Lock your legs around my waist.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: ... We have time for that?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Sometimes you just have to -

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Don't say it.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Is this - like - a normal day for you?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: It's a lousy job, but -  The only reason I stay is for the health benefits.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Here. You shoot. I'll drive.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: ...You know, that's another reason you're probably not in a successful relationship.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Another reason??? Did I miss something???

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: You insist on calling all the shots.  And by the way: I am not a helpless girl.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: If it's radio controlled, it'll break the code.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: If not?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: We blast through.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Sleep well?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Next time, I do the driving.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: What do you mean, you'd rather die alone?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: I didn't say when I want to die -

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Before we go any further here, Mr. Bond, from Lloyds of London, I just want to get two things straight.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: ... Yes?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: First, that boat is in international waters. I'm claiming it for salvage. One-third of that gold is mine.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: And number two?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: If you think we're going to have some kind of 'life affirming' romance here just because we cheated death, let me be clear:  We're going to have it where I want, and when I want.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: And when might that be?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Now.

turns.speaker: M
turns.text: Thank you Colonel Everhart.  007, I'd like to see you in my office. Why don't you and the Colonel exchange numbers if you need more information?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Yes, M.

turns.speaker: M
turns.text: Come in, 007. You know the Minister?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Of course.  Minister Johnstone.

turns.speaker: M
turns.text: Tell me, 007, what do you know about Elliot Harmsway?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Only what I read in the newspapers.

turns.speaker: M
turns.text: - Along with Tomorrow - the first world-wide newspaper. Circulation 27 million. Daily. -

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: 'Able to topple governments with a single story' - as he says in his press.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: ... What's Harmsway done?

turns.speaker: M
turns.text: It seems, 007, we've received a tip

turns.speaker: M
turns.text: The reason I invited the Minister here, 007, was to reassure him that this investigation will be handled with the utmost discretion.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Of course.

turns.speaker: M
turns.text: Which is also why I've withheld this information from NATO and our allies.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: ... Didn't we once investigate Harmsway?

turns.speaker: M
turns.text: Yes. 1988. He was furious at the British plan to return Hong Kong, and supposedly started his own negotiations with the Chinese Government. The inquiry went nowhere - but it did earn MI-6 a rather powerful enemy -

turns.speaker: M
turns.text: You're to wear this mask at the Venice Carnival, and wait to be contacted.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: I understand.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: .... I hate to ask, but... Did you ever think you'd miss Communism?

turns.speaker: M
turns.text: We serve the interests of the British people, 007. No matter who we may be foolish enough to elect.

turns.speaker: M
turns.text: But if Elliot Harmsway is involved with that uranium, I want him prosecuted to the ends of the earth.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Hopefully, it won't get that far.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: ...I'll give you a ring from Venice.

turns.speaker: M
turns.text: Good luck on your mission, 007.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Sorry I'm late -

turns.speaker: M
turns.text: Actually, you're just in time.  Admiral Roebuck: You know Commander Bond, don't you?

turns.speaker: M
turns.text: ...You're turning into quite the politician, 007.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: I have an excellent teacher.  'Make sure you wear the uniform'?

turns.speaker: M
turns.text: What do you make of all this?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: It doesn't quite add up.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: The infrared satellite images. No heat, no flame, no explosion. If that boat went down where they said it did, there should have been some residual heat reading on the surface.

turns.speaker: M
turns.text: Sabotage?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: A three-thousand ton frigate doesn't just vanish into thin air.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: ... And what do you call these?

turns.speaker: JENNY WU
turns.text: Ja-shwa tsway. These are lips.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Indeed they are.  Deadly little things.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: And what do you call these? The Gang of Two?

turns.speaker: JENNY WU
turns.text: Stop it!

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: I was just getting to the interesting part!

turns.speaker: JENNY WU
turns.text: We've already done the interesting part. Do you forget?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Remind me.

turns.speaker: JENNY WU
turns.text: Sakwa!

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Is that Mandarin, or Cantonese?

turns.speaker: JENNY WU
turns.text: Mandarin. You jerk.  I'm late. I have to get dressed.

turns.speaker: JENNY WU
turns.text: Tsi tien, Mr. Bond.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Tsi tien, Professor Wu.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN MORTON
turns.text: Who's in charge here?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: I am. What do you want?

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN MORTON
turns.text: You have precisely one minute to pull up your anchor and be under way.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Forget it. No way. I got here first.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN MORTON
turns.text: Who's Wade?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: What's your name?

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN MORTON
turns.text: Captain Morton.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: My name is Sidney Winch, and -

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN MORTON
turns.text: Good for you, Miss Winch. You now have exactly 30 seconds to get this rust bucket out of here.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: I know my rights. These are international waters. The British Navy abandoned that boat, and I'm claiming it. Under international law, I have the right to salvage what's on that wreck.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN MORTON
turns.text: Fifteen seconds. Perhaps you should consider hiring an attorney.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: I was an attorney!

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN MORTON
turns.text: Hmmm. I suppose this is a step above that profession.  Ten seconds. Are you leaving?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN MORTON
turns.text: You leave me no alternative.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: You won't get away with this!

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN MORTON
turns.text: Good-day, Miss Winch. I advise you to get some steam up - before you run aground.

turns.speaker: EXECUTIVE SECRETARY
turns.text: The Canadian Prime Minister wants to set a lunch -

turns.speaker: HARMSWAY
turns.text: Pencil it in for the next trip -

turns.speaker: EXECUTIVE SECRETARY
turns.text: The American presidential candidate called to complain about that sex story -

turns.speaker: HARMSWAY
turns.text: Send him a $10,000 campaign contribution, and explain I have no control over what my journalists write -

turns.speaker: EXECUTIVE SECRETARY
turns.text: Your bankers want an answer about the Brazilian TV stations

turns.speaker: HARMSWAY
turns.text: No -

turns.speaker: EXECUTIVE SECRETARY
turns.text: The Queen invited you to dinner -

turns.speaker: HARMSWAY
turns.text: Yes -

turns.speaker: EXECUTIVE SECRETARY
turns.text: And the 9:30 news meeting is waiting.

turns.speaker: HARMSWAY
turns.text: Excellent.

turns.speaker: HELMSMAN
turns.text: Damn. It's doing it again.

turns.speaker: FIRST OFFICER
turns.text: What's wrong?

turns.speaker: HELMSMAN
turns.text: About every ninety seconds, the auto- pilot jogs us to the west.

turns.speaker: HELMSMAN
turns.text: The back-up does the same thing.

turns.speaker: FIRST OFFICER
turns.text: Check it again. What about the global positioning satellite? Could there be something wrong with the signal?

turns.speaker: FIRST OFFICER
turns.text: How is it now?

turns.speaker: HELMSMAN
turns.text: Seems to be back to normal, sir.

turns.speaker: FIRST OFFICER
turns.text: A dead head.  Water logged timber. Floats straight up. You sometimes see them on the east side of the channel - from the logging camps on Sumatra - but they don't usually float this far west.  Muncy! Engines to half!

turns.speaker: HELMSMAN
turns.text: Aye-aye sir. Engines to half.

turns.speaker: FIRST OFFICER
turns.text: Chew up a log like that in the propeller, you end up with enough paperwork to go from here to London. Twice.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: What is HE doing here?

turns.speaker: HARMSWAY
turns.text: I see you two have met.

turns.speaker: HARMSWAY
turns.text: Obviously, the British government denies all of this -

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: - I told you! He was there! -

turns.speaker: HARMSWAY
turns.text: - But as I've explained to Sidney, without proof, there's just no story. Don't you agree Mr. Bond?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: He brought that up from the wreck.

turns.speaker: HARMSWAY
turns.text: ...I see.

turns.speaker: HARMSWAY
turns.text: ...Well! I do believe this requires further investigation!

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Thank you, Uncle Elliot.

turns.speaker: HARMSWAY
turns.text: No matter what the British government says, I won't kill this story.  Miss Oxford will show both of you to the elevator... And one of my people will definitely be in touch sooner than later.

turns.speaker: HARMSWAY
turns.text: How sweet.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: My timing always was lousy.

turns.speaker: YUNG
turns.text: That was too close.

turns.speaker: HARMSWAY
turns.text: Don't worry. Mr. Bond will get the message. So will his boss.
